title: Nazi Concentration Camp Guard Age 100 Pleads Not Guilty in German Trial
sub_head: Prosecution of centenarian highlights Germany’s past failure to prosecute senior Nazis, researchers and survivors say
body:
BERLIN—A 100-year-old former concentration camp guard believed to be the oldest person ever to be tried for Nazi-related crimes pleaded not guilty on charges of being accessory to the murder of more than 3,500 inmates.
The man, named only as Josef S., served as a guard and member of the SS Nazi militia at the Sachsenhausen death camp near Berlin, where tens of thousands of people were killed as part of the Nazi extermination effort.
